Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VTSS
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the complaining is about. I stayed two nights, on arriving in and departing from my two-week stay in Spain. The shuttle arrives every twenty minutes (ask directions for where to wait, as the shuttle stops in the Barcelona airport are not at all self-evident--not the hotel's fault, that). Takes 10-15 minutes to get there. Fast, easy check-in. Clean, spacious room. Bathroom was correct. The bar staff was friendly and attentive. I had a breakfast discount included in my online reservations, so it was 9 Eur (15 Eur otherwise)--the buffet was fine. The evening meal menu (either at the bar area or in the resto) was a little limited; I have a special diet, but stil managed to fill up well enough. There is a public transit bus stop with three buses that take you down town--easy to find, and 2 Euro each way. And the staff were very helpful. It is not a tourist trap, but if you aren't afraid of a 20 bus ride, you can get to everything easily enough. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “1 night only”
Reviews.Author: hromator
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel because we thought that it is close to airport (walking). No way, you have to wait for shuttle, not well organise, need next an hour after arriving. Next waiting on check in 20 minutes. Room is very moderate, very bad bathroom, dirty, and damaged, no service minimum 2years. Bar overloaded, finished at 12 PM. Never more.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adjpicks
Reviews.Content: Tryp Barcelona is a very high quality hotel located close to the airport in Barcelona. We received very good service and stayed in a clean, fresh and well appointed room. There are very nice bars and restaurants at the hotel and overall, the hotel was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Watermelon25
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at this hotel. I had problems with my booking, but thankfully to the helpful staff I still got a room. Breakfast wasn't included in the price I paid, and that's a big disadvantage, because breakfast price separately is 15EUR... It is too close to the airport, and too far from the city, so I would rather recommend it for a business trip, but not for leisure. The room was very tidy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dkitty13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel during the General Strike in Barcelona on March 29th. We stayed a total of 2 nights, and were very pleased despite the overwhelming amount of negative comments. The room was bright and clean, the bed was very comfortable and the design of the room allowed for easy movability. The breakfast provided a large variety of breakfast foods, from traditional Spanish delicacies to continental breakfast items. It's 15 euros per person but definitely worth it considering the fact that the hotel is located in an industrial area with basically no eateries around. The shuttle is a great service that they provide and we arrived at the airport on time. Although there is no Wi-Fi availability in the rooms, the hotel provides a comfortable lobby bar with free Wi-Fi access. Overall, this hotel is great for businesspeople and disoriented passengers who necessitate fast access to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Over night stopover”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late at night at terminal 2, found it difficult to find the location of the shuttle bus as it isnt clearly signed, ended up asking someone at the information desk. I had to get a shuttle to terminal 1 which is miles away.Again no signs to indicate where to get the hotel shuttle so I asked another member of staff at the info desk. After what seemed an endless walk along long corridors, down different floor levels,l eventually locate the pick up point where a shuttle bus was waiting much to my relief. After what seemed forever, I arrived at the hotel , just over an hour after leaving terminal 2. I had an early flight to catch the next morning so bearing in mind how long it took me to get to the hotel , I booked the shuttle bus to get me back to the terminal in plenty time. To my surprise, the shuttle dropped me directly to my terminal so only took 10 mins to get there. Very impressed !!!!! room was lovely with plenty toiletries provided. i had 3 beds to choose from ! very pleasant stay even though for just a few hours but my bed was very much needed !

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Brightonian
Reviews.Content: Had to wait over 30 mins for the free shuttle bus. €20 in a taxi and be aware that taxi drivers will not change any note larger than €20! Lobby area is attractive but I was not able to get a drink when meeting people as the bar was closed. Room was fine but I thought the excercise machine in the room was rather strange! Otherwise room had all the usual - mini-bar, TV with some English channels, ensuite bathroom and good size double bed. free wifi. Good double glazing as motorway outside the room. Location is on an industrial estate which was OK for me as I had meetings close by but I would only recomend on the basis of a short stay prior to a flight from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustinTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelona during a very busy conference and so accommodation closer to the city was not possible. The hotel is situated close to the airport but quite far out of town so this should be taken into account when booking. The hotel was clean and comfortable, but depending on your point of reference you may think this is not such a great hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was remarkably quiet, even though it was next to a highway and very close to the airport. There was however a smell in the hotel that was quite overwhelming and I ended up trying to seal off the drains in the bathroom in an attempt to stop it. I would say that this was all in all a very average hotel and if you can find a place closer to the city centre then go for that rather.

Reviews.Title: “no wifi at all”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: i can't find the wifi free service in nearby. anyone know the similar one as this? jplushongkong.com

Reviews.Title: “Could be a really good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: rjmachin
Reviews.Content: Weird mix of places. Smart building in the middle of nowhere, but less than ten minutes from T1 by their regular shuttle (around 25 minutes and €20 from the city). Rooms are OK, clean, functional. WiFi never seems to work and the hotel policy seems to be to never have enough ethernet cables for the rooms - but if you can get hold of one, the connection is red hot! Restaurant is utterly dismal, but the food is pretty good and reasonably priced (likewise the bar - the house tinto and blanco are both pretty good and around €3 for a large glass. Service manages to be both friendly and offhand - don't depend on your wakeup call... could be a really good hotel if they pulled their fingers out a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreasPetro
Reviews.Content: The only reason to choose this hotel would be for an overnight stay between flights. - Far from the town centre - Everything looks really old in the hotel - needs urgent renovation - No wifi - the internet was not working during one of the two nights I stayed

Reviews.Title: “Needs urgent renew”
Reviews.Author: rafaeleberhardt
Reviews.Content: Location is good for those seeking for Airport proximity. However, the hotel is in really bad shape and needs to be renewed. Bedroom and Bathroom looked old, tired and a dirty. No Wifi, but they had a free wired internet connection, although no cables were available in room, front desk had a spare one to borrow, but it was the last one. I highly recommend to bring your own! It was ok for a one night stay, but it wasn't worthy the 100 euros I payed. Next stay will pay the extra buck and stay at the Renaissance close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise”
Reviews.Author: BrazilMaria
Reviews.Content: Just an overnight stay for our flight departed very early in the morning. The food (dinner) was a good surprise. The reception coul have been friendlier, but I guess it was a Sunday night and they rather be somewhere else. Neverthless I would recommend this hotel for its location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It just looked abandoned”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Sandvik
Reviews.Content: Okay, being located in the off-piste business area around Barcelona airport (even my cab driver had to ask for directions), Tryp Barcelona Aeropuerto is not where you are likely to be spending the couple of weeks with the family. On arriving in the late afternoon, it looked dark and abandoned from the outside. However, once inside, you will find that it is quite bright and spacious. The staff speaks English quite adeptly, and service was both courteous and swift. While the restaurant was closed, they served good food in the bar - both tapas and small dinnery dishes. The room was very nice and bright. Don't bother asking for a room with a view, however, unless industrial sights are what you crave. As others have pointed out as well, the bath tub is of the simple and shabby sort. A bit odd, really, as the rest of the the room appeared quite appealing. Internet is, as it should be, free of charge, but they route traffic via their hub in Madrid, so it is quite slow. Expect 1Mbit/200kbit async. Anyway - it is a transit hotel to the airport, and for that, it is excellent! They offer free shuttle service to BCN every 20 minutes (it seems), at least in the morning. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jojo_cgn
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days there on a business trip. My expectations were not very high, as I had read some bad appraisals before. Actually it was a positive surprise. My room was right as rain and clean. Breakast was also okay. The hotel is located in the industrial area behind the aiport - definately not a fancy hotspot - but fair enough to stay there for a couple of days, if you have to do business there or in case you have a late arrival or an early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are neat but bathrooms are not”
Reviews.Author: btravel1410
Reviews.Content: If you are staying for 2 nights then its ok , the room is nice just the bath tubs are not maintained well. Their shuttle service to and from the airport is too good and infact that was the main reason we booked with them

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the reviews I'm reading. This place is a DUMP. The rooms are very, very small. I had to change my room 3 times. The first room was smoke filled, and it was supposed to be "smoke free", the second room smelled like sewage back up, and the last room we just tollerated. The carpet on the floors outside our room was stained and dirty. This was just a glimpse of what awaited us inside the room. It was clean, but the furniture CHEAP. the beds looked like roll-away beds and the only picture I saw throughout the entire hotel was on the wall of our room. I guess when a hotel advertises as a 4 star I'm certainly expecting luxury. Honestly this is a hotel to wash and go. Nothing about it was inviting. We didnot sleep in the beds and slept with all lights on. I was so discussed. I was traveling with a group of people so I tuffed it out. I would not recommend this hotel at all if you are looking for comfort. If you need a place to CRASH for the night and take a shower then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars?!”
Reviews.Author: Dentate
Reviews.Content: Promoted as a Four Star International Airport hotel, this is but an overnight 2-star crash pad. The rooms are spartan, with few softening creature comforts. The cloth upholstery of the lounge furniture should either be drycleaned or replaced. Restaurant meals are uninspired and costly. There is a free shuttle to the airport (as one would expect), and for some strange reason it appears favoured by tour groups. Overall: not good value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and convenient”
Reviews.Author: coverking
Reviews.Content: Because our flight arrival was late in the evening we decided to stay near the airport before moving on next day. The Tryp is conveniently situated for both the airport and car rental depots. On arrival the reception staff were freindly, helpful and multi-lingual. The room was well appointed and comfortable. We paid extra for breakfast and were surprised to find that as well as the expected array of cold meats cheese and croissants there was also a hot buffet with a "full English" choice. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: 2nothome
Reviews.Content: We read some negative reviews of the Tryp hotel, but our experience was very good. We stayed one night in between flights. We used their shuttle from the airport to the hotel, and took it again the next day for our very early morning flight. They provide complimentary coffee for early risers. Shuttles come about every 20 minutes from 7AM to 11PM, but must be reserved for other hours. We found the staff efficient, and our room very comfortable. This is not a hotel to stay in for a visit to Barcelona, but it's great if you need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LollipopCanada
Reviews.Content: On our way back from a Mediteranean cruise, we spent one night in that hotel, before flying home the next day. The cruise Star Princess drove us from the port of Barcelona to the airport of Barcelona, there the shuttle bus took us to the hotel, it was a 15 minutes ride. The entrance of the hotel being so long and big, noise and steps echo, and it feels unwarm. But to the contrary, the staff was so warm and helpful, we changed our minds right away. We had lunch in their restaurant, great buffet. We had breakfast the next morning before flying home, what an elaborated breakfast. The room was very nicely equipped, large bed and very comfortable. The next day, we took the shuttle bus to the airport and flew home. Very pleased to have found that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modern but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: zbestcalgary
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern enough (and in the middle of no where) but service was very poor. Its shocking that a 4 start hotel did not have wifi for its customers. The only option was to line up and the front desk (which often was as 30 minute wait) and pay by the hour for an internet wire - which would not have attached to our apple ipad anyway. Since we had to rebook our airline seat due to a cancelled flight the only option was a brutally expensive phone call. A call of no more than 15 minutes to the UK resulted in a bill of about 50 euros. The person at the front desk had no empathy about this and insisted on receiving the full amount - nothing like a mark-up of 1000%. No doubt the lack of free wifi was designed to bring in extra billing - including excessive phone charges. Check in took forever even though there was only 1 person ahead of us. I have no idea what reception staff was doing but all they had to do was take a voucher from the airline. Meals were not much better, the buffet was by far the worst food we had in Spain. The staff at the meals were not friendly and most people ate and left after about 15 minutes due to the negative attitude of the restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andycap_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way out of Barcelona. Would only recommend it as a stop if you are using the airport. The hotel is very modern and we found the service good. Unless you feel like a long taxi ride into Barcelona you need to have all your meals in the hotel restaurant. This hotel is in the business district and was difficult to find by car. Like a lot of these new hotels the advertised address does not include a street number and our GPS could not locate it. We had to phone the establishment to obtain the street number.

Reviews.Title: “Restoring the Values”
Reviews.Author: Peiotraveller
Reviews.Content: I would just like to show my gratitude to an attitude which is unfortunately out of date in most locations. I had a small incident with my pants and I was in urgent need of a sewing kit , thus I approached lobby of the hotel. Since they did not have any kit with them they sent a lady to my room to provide me the necessary items for sewing. But my surprise came when the lady herself told me she would do it for me, she took the pants with her and after 10 minutes they where fit again! Amazing, this kind of behaviour are unfortunately lost. Thanks Mrs. Sonia for your action.

Reviews.Title: “Not near the airport10 mins by taxi (20€ if night time)”
Reviews.Author: filippobull
Reviews.Content: It's not that close to the airport: 10 mins by taxi but as it was night it was 20€!... Shuttle service in the morning was good. It's not a cheap hotel and it's not worth for what it should be: being close to the airport. And evenmore wi-fi is not free: outrageous!!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: InesR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to the airport and we stayed there because our flight had been cancelled. I saw cochroaches in my bedroom and the room wasn´t very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamminhd
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute for our early flight out of Barcenlona. We arrived pretty late and although the wait at the front desk was longer then normal this was not due to the staff at the hotel. It was due to the customers they were patiently helping. Check in went smooth and the hotel staff were probably some of the best I have ever encountered. Although it was busy they did not rush and answered your questions and were extremely helpful. We were concerned about getting something to eat and they explained there was room service or they had a pizza menu for a local pizzeria and would order it for us. The hotel itself is very modern and very beautiful. The room was also very beautiful and modern along with the bathroom. We orderd room service and not only was is prompt; the food was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. There was plenty food unlike other hotels. We later went to the bar area to get water and the staff at the bar was just as helpful and friendly as the front desk. We were actually disappointed we weren't able to stay longer and take advantage of the comfortable bed and beautiful room. We had a very early flight in the morning and the hotel staff made sure we received our wake up call and verified the time of our shuttle. For the price we paid (which was extremely reasonable) and the location to the airport; we will be staying there again when we travel to Spain next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not really close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our overnight stay in Barcelona before heading back home. It is proclaimed as the closest hotel to Barcelona Airport's Terminal 1 but it still took about 7 minutes by cab to get there. The hotel itself is very nice--clean, modern, comfortable and perfect for a layover. Checkin was a bit slow but other than that, I have no complaints. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport so we were able to take advantage of that the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected. I definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: felix33442
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 247, and were very impressed with the room, the beds, the service, and the friendliness of the staff. The room was spotless, room service was fast (we ordered extra pillows), the towels were fresh and there was the usual abundance of Melia amenities (everything from a comb to a toothbrush and toothpaste are pre-wrapped and offered in the bathroom for your convenience). We stayed for only one night, as we wanted to make sure to make our early morning flight back to the U.S. Parking is $15 Euro under the hotel, but free and plentiful on the sidewalks right in front of the hotel. They offer a free shuttle every 20 minutes every morning to the airport for guests. We booked the hotel with the buffet breakfast (opens at 6:30am) and while it was early to eat, the food was good, plentiful, with lots of options to choose from regardless of your nationality. I thought the hotel would be rundown, but it was just the opposite. The lobby was clean, comfortable and enormous. There is a gym, but we never even looked. A lobby cafe offers good coffee, drinks and sandwiches. A bus out front takes guests directly to the center of the Ramblas, but if you go this route, be sure to make sure what time the last bus runs back as it's a hefty taxi ride from town. A great -- and inexpensive -- hotel for when you are leaving back to the States. Not a place to stay for exploring Barcelona but great for ensuring you don't miss your flight!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, ordinary rooms”
Reviews.Author: laurie_mclellan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel served its purpose as a place to spend the night after a late flight arrival. The rooms are quite ordinary with wifi as an extra cost. Breakfast was great. Staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: MadMackem034
Reviews.Content: We waited 45 minutes for the "shuttle" to pick us up at 9pm eventaully opting for a taxi. The hotel itself is ok, the restaurant open until 11pm leaves a lot to be desired. The buffet only was offered and it was one star along withe the sullen service. I unfortunately was there for 2 nights, the second night my first 2 menu choices we unavailable, my starter and main were plonked down in front of me within 1 minute of each other by a miserable server. No outside space or anywhere to walk to, very overpriced for what you got, would not recommend - I will definitely feed this back to our travel organisers as I won't be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Location Wonderful, clean room, quiet”
Reviews.Author: dondee9
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. One gentleman at the front desk was under pressure and cranky when I asked for assistance. I apologized so he perhaps could be more friendly. One of the ladies was helpful. The shuttle service was very good and comes every 20 minutes. I went in for dinner and it was unbelievably expensive for the unappetizing food displayed. I lost my appetite looking at it and I had a cup of tea and an apple.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: moonpig1999
Reviews.Content: I write very few reviews, but use the sight all the time. Tryp hotel in Barcelona compelled me to write a review. What BAD, BAD, BAD service. No to mention, only wifi in the lobby at 5 Euro per 30 min. RIP OFF Did not make the up room during the day… front desk staff 'they must have forgotten, we will do it first thing in the morning'. Wifi does not work in the restaurant, but it does at the bar. You can not eat at the bar. Could not even order room service at the bar. I ordered from the room, then took it down… talk about some pissed off staff. Shuttle bus was 20 min late They were painting the hall by my room and the smell was really bad. I asked if they would move my room… they suggested I just open my window as it was trouble for them to move me and they would have to charge me. You can not make this stuff up. Just bad service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: mradford
Reviews.Content: We drove to Barcelona from France the night before flights (to Canada and California with stops in the East of the US). We chose the Tryp hotel based on convenience. It was expensive compared to hotels at this time of year in central Barcelona. There was no one in the lobby when we got there on the shuttle - no person to help with the luggage, no one at the desk. Finally someone appeared, reluctant to help check us in. We purchased wifi internet at a steep rate - got to the room - it didn't work. Eventually we got our money back after an admission that it didn't work very well. There was mold in the bathroom and grout missing between tiles, the road/plane noise was worse than I've ever experienced near an airport. The directions we were given to downtown Barcelona by city bus were faulty and resulted in a 3 hour horror of a return journey late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: swdweeb
Reviews.Content: The staff did a terrific job. The entire hotel was clean and well maintained. As with most European hotels, forget about air conditioning ;-) If you need a place to stay and don't mind being a taxi ride away from the city center or harbor this is a good hotel. If you're looking to walk to Las Ramblas this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaLodz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the airport (offers free transportation - shuttle bus) among the offices of many companies. Getting to the city center is quite complicated about 1/2 mile to the bus stop and then about 40 minutes by bus (no L87) and metro. The hotel has a modern design and looks well maintained. The rooms are large and well equipped. The rooms and bathrooms clean. Service friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel when we arrive late or are flying in the morning. This is not the hotel, which can be considered as a place of lstay during a longer stay in Barcelona (far from main attractions).

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, where do I start???”
Reviews.Author: nononsens
Reviews.Content: Avoid if you can, favoured by Iberia/BA airlines for placing stranded customers. Nice lobby but service rather muted, one or two helpful receptionists and that is it. Bar area with quick sand like seating completed with ripped covers, very shoddy indeed. As for food, you'll get same limited boring menu for lunch and dinner. Room ok-ish but we didn't have any water in the morning it took them 30mins to sort it out, not the best response when you have only 40 mins to leave to catch your flight. For being 4* not impressed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: travellller
Reviews.Content: With the weather problems at Heathrow we were forced to spend a night at the TRYP Barcelona. Given the number of cancelled flights etc, the hotel seemed to be packed with loads of weary travellers arriving on every shuttle (each half hour). The staff at the front desk handled the situation extremely well and spoke good english. We found the rooms to be clean and well appointed - very utilitarian. The manager (Magdalena) was extremely helpful . When we were unable to hook up our laptop to the internet, she was right there to assist (and did manage to get our connection working). We did the airport check-in using our laptop, and Magdalenda even helped us print our boarding passes in the back-office. In fact knowing airport requirements, she printed the boarding passes in duplicate. She was very visible throughout the hotel and was always cheerful with a nice smile. Clearly she managed the place by example. The staff's general willingness to assist was particularly welcome, given the stressful situation faced by the guests because of flight disruptions, etc. We had vouchers for the restaurant and used them for lunch and dinner. The buffet was nothing to write home about, but it met the basic needs of a tired traveller. The free shuttle to and from the airport was a good touch. Although the hotel's location is quite far from the city center and the Ramblas, there is public transportation only about a block and a half from the hotel. All in all, while this was no Four Seasons, it was a decent enough airport hotel, especially if you are stuck with cancelled flights. We enjoyed our hotel room and slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, too many stars”
Reviews.Author: HongKongB
Reviews.Content: Quite adequate - but no way is this a 4 star hotel worth what they charged us. No help with our luggage, no doorman, one lovely person working the desk and juggling phones plus customers. Extra charge for internet, no proper business center and bathroom amenities were not replenished on the second night of our stay. We got a 2:30 wake-up call which we did not request and the cleaning crew had little regard for guests trying to sleep-in. The best part of the stay was the early am shuttle to the airport- but aside from that there's no reason to stay there when the city center is just a few minutes further from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentCLT
Reviews.Content: Easy access with free shuttle to Barcelona Airport - as well as close to public transportation to downtown Barcelona and Las Ramblas - clean - modern hotel

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalinD
Reviews.Content: When my plane was cancelled I had to find a hotel quickly with good quality, and I found Tryp Barcelona Aeropuerto! I came in the evening and I was welcomed with a smile by the man in the front desk. The hotel had a warm atmosphere with the small bar and the open spaces. A nice place to relax and meet new people. The hotelroom were like any other hotelrooms with it´s big bed that takes up most of the space. The bathroom was very modern and had everything you needed - except for those mystic hairs in the bathtub.. One more thing, how do you get in contact with the hotel? There´s no number or email adress to find anywhere. How come?

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport and has shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: Muyassar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my friends because my flight was cancelled and it was nearest hotel to the airport. I general this hotel was good, clean, friendly staff and shuttle in the morning. I need to contact with this hotel, I was searching for their phone number, but I couldn't find anything... If somebody knows their number can you give me that? Thank you in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Better than many of the previous reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: mteq
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in mid October. Our flight was delayed and we got to the hotel at 3am. The front desk man was pleasant and helpful, and our room was fine - clean and prepared. There is no soap, only soap dispensers (not appropriate for a hotel of it's claimed quality) but otherwise we were very happy with our experience. We did not eat there at all. Also we couldn't get wifi to work. We could see why there might be complaints about the bus service but we were returned to the airport the following morning with no problems. When we arrived we were charged €20 to get from the airport (as others have reported) for a metered fare of €10 - we were told this was a minimum charge; at that time in the morning who is going to argue? For 2 very tired travellers, we were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pros outweigh the cons”
Reviews.Author: Mamasue1
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because we were flying out of BCN the next morning and it was close to the airport. A little tricky to locate, despite our GPS, because of the local construction. Once there, the facilities were clean, modern, impressive and rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. On site restaurant ("Snack Bar") was not the best - recommend steering clear of the main entrees as they were disappointingly overpriced and underportioned. Stick with the sandwiches and salads - those around us who ordered these seemed to have made a much better choice. Also, negative reports about the hotel transport to and from the airport were, in our experience, correct. To catch the van to the hotel you do indeed have to go to the outer limits of the airport property (by foot) - a real task if you were to have a lot of luggage. Also, the hotel does not request that one make reservations for the morning transport to the airport, so it's probably routine for there to be more bodies than seats for the van that runs ever half hour - that was our experience. We were unlucky enough to not win the race for seats, and had to pay 25 EU for the ten minute taxi ride to the airport.... So the best rule is, allow an hour to get from the hotel to the airport so you can make alternative arrangements - or else, just take a cab and forget the hotel van.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reception, poor understanding of service company.”
Reviews.Author: Javier_Moragrega
Reviews.Content: The guy from reception was not willing to listen my problems when finding the hotel, which is impossible unless you come from the airport; he was rude even that I spoke his language (I am native spanish) and when I wanted to have a coffe, in the bar they replied to me while walking away that the minimium qty. was 6€... .....BAD quality for such a price, will not come back, i swear.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Motel - There must be better options”
Reviews.Author: teresita21
Reviews.Content: Certainly not worth the 180 euros (yes, euros) we paid the convenience of staying near the airport on our last night, Pros: * Very close to the airport and they provide a free shuttle (you must call when you arrive at the airport and the pick up point is located outside the far edge of the parking lot). * Breakfast was tasty and convenient. Cons: * Motel quality rooms at 4 star hotel prices (bars of soap are not given, rather there are liquid soap dispensers attached to the wall above the sink and in the shower.) * You are in the middle of nowhere and there no other food options besides the hotel unless you take a bus into town * Shuttle service to airport is not organized and is literally a free for all in the morning. We saw pushing and arguing for seats on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nest of thieves”
Reviews.Author: antonlaut
Reviews.Content: We went for breakfast and our handbags with passport and all our money and credit cards were stolen from our rooms. The management were completely hands off.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay before your flight”
Reviews.Author: FLFloridagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for proximity to the airport before our morning flight. There is a city bus that takes you to the Barcelona sites in thirty minutes. We used the hotel shuttle to get to the airport. It leaves the hotel every twenty minutes. We found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful. Our room was large with everything that we needed. We ate at the hotel lobby restaurant, the only place open for dinner. The food was good, the menu varied and not over priced. We paid for dinner with Euros since we were going home and had extra cash. We were short changed by the bus boy/server, who did not seem surprised when we pointed out his error. He quickly brought us the correct change. Be aware and count your change.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly reseption”
Reviews.Author: krmt
Reviews.Content: We stayd one nihgt at the hotel. It was a late evening when we arrived and the hotel room was very hot. first I opened the window to get some fresh air and after 20min I turned the air condition on to make the room cooler. We went to sleep soon, but about an hour later I woke up because it was extremely hot. The air condition only blow some hot air, thougt I turn it any how. Due it was mid night and we had very early flight I tried to sleep and didnt call to room service. In the morning I told them the problem, but they did't even say they were sorry. Then they asked me my credit card to pay and I friendly asked, didn't they took the payment already yesterday when they asked my card. The aswer was very loud and agnry "Yesterday we took it just to check your credit. you can chech it from your bank we didnt charge any thing." Things just can be said in two different ways; friendly or not friendly. This hotel represent the last version.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you intend to shower.”
Reviews.Author: BigDogDue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Barcelona Aeropuerto before an early morning flight. The proximity to the airport was convenient. And while not exceptional, the room was relative clean and comfortable. However, when we went to take showers in the morning, the only water available was scalding hot. It turns out the entire hotel's cold water supply had been disabled by some bug in their system. When we complained at check out, the receptionist said "Well I don't mean to blame you, but if you had called the front desk, we could have reset the water system in 5 minutes." Somehow we were supposed to know that the problem was systemic. Add to this experience a grumpy old shuttle bus driver, and it was an all around miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you need to be next to the airport for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellinmom
Reviews.Content: We booked the Alvin room. This is a family room with bunk beds and a few posters of the new Alvin movie. There were supposed to be Alvin activity backpacks for my kids in the room. But they were out. Great, I'm glad I paid extra for that! There was a divider between the kids side and the adults side, but no door. And the TV was on the kids side. So we went to bed when they went to bed. The biggest surprise was that the sink drain did not work. The sink drained directly on to the floor. Yes, they did know about this. Also a few settings on the jacuzzi tub did not work. The front desk clerk did speak English, but was a little snooty. She was not willing to tell me how to get downtown other than "drive and look for parking signs." I would only book this if you needed to be close to the airport. Don't book this as a destination hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvldude61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a 7 day cruise 2 nights too see Barcelona before our trip home. People at the desk spoke good english, were very helpfull and gave us good directions for inexpensive travel by bus (1.35 euro's per person per ride) to city center (Playa del Cataluyna), bus stop was a no problem 5 min walk from hotel, bus runs every 20 mins, we did not feel threatened in any way at any time in our trip through Europe. Don't know what I was charged due to package pricing. Room was O.K. the included breakfast was quite good. Ride to town was easy and fairly quick and much cheaper than a cab. I recommend this hotel if you don't mind taking the bus to get to Barcelona and note that there isn't much around there, the only place we saw to buy something was a gas station type grocery store near the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pstar11
Reviews.Content: My first and last stay at a Tryp hotel. The room was small and had not been cleaned. The a/c did not work and the window cannot be opened more than 2 inches before it hits the curtain rod. There was only one bath towel for two adults. We were on the third floor across from a door marked Office 3 which banged constantly as maids went in and out. The woman on the front desk disagreed with me when I asked a question about confirming my flight and was quite rude until I showed her how to do it. Nor did she apologize for her mistake. We went to the snack bar for a meal which took two hours until we realized that the waiter was also tending bar at the same time. Bad vibes all around.

Reviews.Title: “Not for stays longer than one night”
Reviews.Author: Gllobe-trotter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel many times (more than 10) since 2007 as it's next to the office of my company. Location: Business/industrial suburbs of Barcelona near the airport. Nothing interesting to see in the distance of some 10 km. No bars, no restaurants, really NOTHING. The only way to go to Barcelona is by taxi (20-40€). There's a shuttle bus service to go there from the airport: during the day every 20 min. from the old terminal (T2) and once per hour (!) from the new one (T1). Taxi: 20€. The hotel next to a motorway, so if you are unlucky and you'll get the room from that side (50% of chances), you'll hear the traffic all the night. Hotel / room: It should have rather three stars instead of four. Not very big rooms with very basic (and sometimes broken) equipment. Restaurant open in the evenings only until 22:00. During the days it's a big conference room. You can eat at the bar. Reception desk - only two stands and long procedure at check-in. The only facility on place is a small fitness room. Internet - 6€ / 12 hours. Don't choose it for a stay longer than one night.

Reviews.Title: “I Appreciated the Friendliness of the Staff”
Reviews.Author: gdwishes4u
Reviews.Content: The first night I stayed I was impressed with the staff, the food, the decor, internet accessability, and professionalism. The sheets were dirty with a black dirt. I was too tired to change rooms, so I slept on top of the white duvet. The second time, a week later, I had a perfectly clean room and everything about the hotel was wonderful. It was a great place to stay before catching a plane the next day. 105 euros a night. Worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Shame about the Air Con...????!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: winnipeg08
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel arriving about 11pm, the air con wasnt working, so we moved rooms, we had 4 rooms in all, the air con was stillnot working, but we had had enough by now. So we opened the window in desparation to cool down, about 4 am, my friend woke and had been bitten at least 14 times on her face and eye lid, and her face was swollen and eye was completely shut from swelling. The next morning went to breakfast, which was cold. When we checked out we explained we had had to open the window because there was no air con working and breakfast was cold and we were not happy, the did give us 50% off the price of our room, but the damage was done by this time. we were staying in Barcelona from 04/06/09 to 08/06/09 and my friends face did not look any better for 3 days. I cant fault the cleanliness of the Hotel, but surely the air conditioning is important to most people who stay in Hotels in a hotter country than ours. We wouldnt reccommend this Hotel unless you have a guarentee that the air con is working.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickyross6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Barcelona for one night because we arrived late into Barcelona airport. We rang the hotel once we arrived to check where to get the bus from. It arrived shortly afterwards to take us to the hotel. The room was comfy and modern. The lobby was a big space but managed to feel quite cosy when we popped down late for a drink and a decent club sandwich. Staff were helpful in giving us information on how to get into town.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service with the shuttle bus driver, otherwise ok”
Reviews.Author: dot927
Reviews.Content: Don't you love a grouchy driver who won't wait for hotel guests, asks the guests to get the porter trolley and get them to push the trolley into the hotel? If you do, then Tryp is your destined stay! Aside from that, the hotel is alright. Not great, but a good value stay for under a hundred euros (breakfast not incl, as we had to leave before the buffet opens).

Reviews.Title: “Stark, but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kauai22
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after our cruise. Very stark, modern furnishings-but comfortable bed and overstuffed chair. Great room service - food was hot and tasty. I asked for a table and they brought one ASAP. Early am to airport - free shuttle much appreciated, also free continental breakfast in lobby at 0500. Adjacent to freeway, so traffic noise with open window. One bonus - one block to a service station with a restaurant that served decent tapas and light meals outside of the traditional Spanish dining hours so we could eat at 1130.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to Connect to a Flight, not a Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: criancadodeus
Reviews.Content: When we got to the airport and told the taxi driver to take us to this hotel, he told us there was a premium charge. The hotel was so close (less than 5 minutes drive) that it was not worth his time to get out of the line, drop us off and return to pick up passengers who were going on to other Barcelona hotels. So we paid the price. I believe there is shuttle service at the hotel, so if you are staying, you may ask to be picked up. When we got there, the room was stark, but clean. The hotel itself is very stark and minimal. However, we needed to get to a flight the next day and had the shuttle took us free of charge at 4 a.m. We checked out of the hotel around 3:30 a.m. and that was not a problem. So if you are staying there to catch a plane, it is great. If you are looking for a vacation spot, you may want to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulBaileyPBAUK
Reviews.Content: Was given a list at the Information desk at Barcelona airport after our incoming flight was delayed and missed our connection. Phoned three different hotels and the Tryp was the least expensive. Good efficient airport shuttle service took us onto a commercial estate adjacent to the airport. What the hell - it's only an overnight whilst waiting for a flight - so does the external location matter too much? Most importantly, the rooms are bright, clean and well furnished, the bar/snack bar does reasonable food in short time and if you are having to spend a night anywhere near an airport, you could certainly do much worse than this

Reviews.Title: “Mismanaged overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hegu
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because we arrived late in Barcelona and had to take a mid day flight the next day, i e no idea to go to the city and back. We got a resonable rate, I thought, around 80 Euros per night for a 4 star hotel. However, there is nothing 4 star at all about this hotel. The staff at check in were unfreindly and unhelpful. When we arrived around 10 pm, there was nothing to eat, only a small bar open. Hardly any English spoken there as well. No cigarettes and no food, not even a sandwich to buy in the hotel ("go to town" for food and cigarettes, they suggested in the bar). I thought that airport hotels had basic things like this 24 hours a day. We went to our room just to find that there was room service which had some sandwiches and sallads so we ordered (why could they not have said that in the bar?). The "international" TV-channels are in Spanish, German, Arabic, just about any language than English. In the morning (10.30 a m) we went to the bar for a cup of coffee to find it closed and dark but according to a sign it should be open. An angry staff member told us it is closed. I asked why and showed her the sign. She said "oh really?" and watched her clock and run away, probably to find the person to open it. Breakfast closed as well but managed to come in anyway for coffee (expensive). To be a a airport hotel which caters for guests arriving around the clock from differenet time zones you might expect more professional English speaking staff, a 24 hour a day open cafe or kiosk and English TV-channels. And a smile and some helpfulness would be nice, but I guess it comes as an extra cost then.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - NO AIR CONDITIONING”
Reviews.Author: sprucewood
Reviews.Content: To begin, most people stay here - as I did because of its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle bus. While the rooms are somewhat small, they are clean and modern. That is about the only good thing to say about this place. We stayed there on a HOT August night to find almost non-existent air conditioning. After checking the system, the service technician told me the AC was working fine. The front desk staff told me that this was a common complaint when it is hot (my question was, when is is NOT hot?). My husband and I had to put wet towels on our faces to cool down enough to get about 3 hours sleep. It was nothing short of terrible.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: AirCon66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an industrial estate near the airport. It's OK for an overnight, but not for a lengthy stay. The room was spacious and clean and, at 82 euros, was not expensive. The free airport shuttle service is handy if you want to connect with the Aerobus from the airport to Barcelona (4 euros each way). Breakfast is a bit pricey at 14 euros, but there was good range of hot and cold food. However, the hotel is obviously well-used and it is showing some wear at the edges. Also, the air-con in the room was so poor that it was ineffective. Yet, according to the hotel's "servicios technicos", it was not faulty.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Tryp Bacelona”
Reviews.Author: LLarwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a brief say at Tryp Barcelona Aeropuerto. The hotel was recommended by AAA as one of the finest hotels in the city, and proudly lists a 4-star rating on the door. It also has a 4-star price (200 Euros per night). The hotel is near the airport (a plus), but on a broken street filled with construction. 3 of our 4 taxi drivers could not find it immediately (even with GPS). Here are a few of the real negatives: Trash not emptied, towels not complete and not changed, no soap or amenities, floor dirty, toilet running, shower handle fell off into the tub, towel rack self-disassembled and partly fell into the tub. Add that to: far from a taxi stand, no concierge, no gift shop, no material in English and the 4-star rating becomes a joke. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Have you said 4-star?”
Reviews.Author: marko5210
Reviews.Content: When you have a connexion flight at barcelona airport and you've to stay one night here, this hotel is well located (5 minutes-drive fron the airport). I've seen better 4 stars hotels..; my room wasn't very clean (especially the bathroom). Poor services (if you want, you have to pay..). A little noisy (motorways passing just close to the hotel). For me it's a nice 3-star hotels but at the price of a 5 ! Breakfast is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I was hoping for a good stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sidgul
Reviews.Content: I had read all of the reviews on Trip Advisor but decided to book this hotel anyway as it was the best price point for me and close to the airport. We stayed here as we had an overnight layover on our flight. I really wanted our stay to go smoothly and it did for the most part but there were still some problems. The shuttle is hard to find but I don't think this is the fault of the hotel, the airport was busy, not clearly marked, and there was no one to ask at 8pm on a Monday night. I was prepared for this from the reviews but still took me awhile. The "hotel bus" sign is small, also not the fault of the hotel. I called the bus (lucky to have a spanish cell) and it came in 25 minutes- I think I had just missed the previous bus. It is important to know that if you are in terminal B (international) just come out, turn right and the bus stop is just passed the taxis. I went all the way left and had to come back. The hotel is very close but the shuttle has to take a longer route due to construction and security issues. Check in was easy, and the room was very nice but the heater was broken. They promptly moved me to another room and moved all of my bags. The huge plus for me was the Fitness Room, which I had booked that had a treadmill in it so I could run while my 8 month baby slept. They have rooms with bikes, eliptical machines, and treadmills but you have to book them in advance and if you want a special machine make sure you ask. Room service was good, easy, and economical. Breakfast was really good, but a little expensive at 15 euros. THe shuttle in the morning was ontime, easy, and empty so I had no problems with that. Half of the hotel is on the highway, and our room was on that side- but I didnt think that noise was bad at all- just sounded like the wind to me. THere was road construction in the middle of the night but I only noticed because I woke up for the baby. The roadworks is also not the fault of the hotel. So overall the stay was good- the fitness machine in the room was great. I would stay here again but I would make sure to ask for the things I wanted and am prepared for everything like the shuttle. I know there are a lot of bad reviews for this hotel but I think it is important to seperate the hotel problems from the airports problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Nu327
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in the hotel, just because we had a flight early in the morning. The hotel is perfect for that! The rooms are confortable, spacious and well decorated, in a business hotel style! The staff is really friendly. The restaurant is ok, there's a buffet with a reasonable price and food is good! The best thing, for us, was the shutle to the airport! It arrived at time and in ten minutes we were in our terminal!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kyim
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay over in Barcelona following a cruise and catching my flight home the next day at 8am. I booked this hotel as it was near the airport. I found the staff very unhelpful, the air conditioning has been turned off as they considered it was no longer hot, I suggested surely it was the guest who should make that judgement, they explanied NO! Dinner is not available until 8.30pm not helpful when you have a very early morning flight. There is no duty manager after 7pm. My room was hot and stuffy and I opened the window but heard the motorway traffic all night! Reception does not pick up calls from the rooms twice I had to get dressed to get their attention as they would not answer, what would happen in an emergency??? Another guest above had their TV on until 4.30am - reception did not respond to calls. This is a poorly run hotel with little or no attempt at customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see the amount of negativity below about this hotel...I was quite comfortable, well-taken care of and enjoyed my one night there before my early AM flight the next day. The room was slighly too modern...It was comfortable, but not what I would consider warm and inviting. It's almost as if they tried too hard to be this art-deco type place. But that being said, the bathroom was nice, the TV was nice and the bed was comfortable. I like my room ICE COLD, and the a/c was adequate for me...And yes, you do have to have your key in the door for the A/C and other electronics to stay on, but that's common all over Europe and Asia. But here's a little hint--always ask for an extra key at check-in, and leave a key in the slot at all times! I had a pretty good meal in the hotel's restaurant, but it seemed moe like an impromptu-banquet-room-converted-to-a-restaurant. The look and feel was kind of weird. But I enjoyed my food, so I have no real complaints. The shuttle promptly left when they said it would, and I made it to the airline's check-in maybe 20 minutes after leaving my room. Convenient hotel, good value for the money...I would stay here again if I had another early-AM flight out of BCN!

Reviews.Title: “Very well priced modern airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lourdy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 5mins away from airport and hotel offers a shuttle service FOC. Rooms are modern ,very clean and comfortable. The Staff were very friendly and offer traditional Christmas sweets and tea /coffee and biscuits. This hotel is not recomended for long stays as taxi to city center costs aprox EUR 27.00. A cheaper option to access City center is to take Shuttle bus to airport and train to City center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last night in Barcelona following a mediterranean cruise. From the moment I walked in I got a terrible feeling. The hotel was grey, bare and cold. The temperature of the rooms was terrible, hot and humid and the electricity did not work unless the key card was in the door. I found this rather budget and uncomfortable. The beds had itchy sheets and were hard. I had asked the front desk about the free shuttle bus to the airport and they informed me that they did not take reservations for it and it was on a first come first serve basis, so I got out there way before its schedueled stop to hold seats for the 11 people I was travelling with and when it finally came and my whole party had arrived we had to fight to get seats because no one enforced any order to the process.I believe that my mother booked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, but i would rather stay anywhere but here if I needed to be close to the airport. i would never ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkandfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on June 7th for one night since we had an early flight the following day. I don't think that we ever experienced such a fiasco! It started with our attempt to get directions on how to get to the hotel from the front desk. The recpetionist answering the phone said that she was busy and hung up the phone. It followed by getting rooms with no air conditioning and a staff that thought that opening the window is a sufficient solution. The rooms were located above the highway (what noise!!!) which that night had construction work done under our window. We discovered that the so called free breakfast buffet was half emptied by a large group that ate before we came. I won't even quote what there reply was to our complaint. Stay away from this Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to get to from the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Chiefmo78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean and very close to the airport. My husband and I were there overnight to catch our flight the next morning. We had a very hard time finding the airport shuttle because a guy driving a shuttle turned us down then we had to take all of our luggage down to the next concourse and proceed to wait 20 minutes for another shuttle. The hotel was very easy to check into and the room was very neat. We were disappointed with our shower because it sprayed everywhere, we never got it positioned right. We didn't have problems getting the shuttle the next morning, the shuttles run constantly from the hotel to the airport. I was also disappointed that the hotel didn't have better locks on the door, there was just a standard lock but no chain or latch from the inside.

Reviews.Title: “The shuttle is unreliable - The hotel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: This is a nice business hotel with style. However, if you are depending on the Shuttle be sure to make other plans. Taxi is about 7 euros. We waited for 30 minutes at the airport and some people didn't get on. The next morning the same story and we didn't get on. They only had one shuttle running and they knew they had a problem. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, so you will have to eat all meals at the hotel. It is not for women travelling alone, unless you have no plans to leave the hotel. The bus into Plaza Catalunya (L95) is 1.20 Euros. The bus stop is on a highway frontage road that had open prostitution in the afternoon. On the return, we had to walk among them to return to the hotel. The hotel also had problems with the showers. Scalding, Fridgid than 30 seconds of just right, before we started the cycle again. We are big Melia and Tryp fans, but this is not one of their best hotels. However, for the airport this is the place. We have been travelling back and forth from Barcelona for 6 years and this is our regular stop. The people who wrote that they stay here for visiting the city are crazy., This is too inconvenient for the city. It is an airport only hotel. For work and meetings it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja
Reviews.Content: I got fair offer for this hotel from hotel chain´s main website. Outside airport it was hard to find where that free hotel bus was stopping. After asking from tourist information it was easy. F.ex. from Terminal B arrivals go outside, turn right and walk 100m (350ft). After taxi line you find small white sing: HOTEL BUS. It will pick up you from there every 20 min. At nights 23-05 (11PM-05AM) you have to call to hotel and its phonenumber is in that sign. They will pick up you then shortly after. Check in was polite, staff has good language skills of english, spanish and german. This hotel is a find, bargain - value for stay! It is spotless, clean and modern. Room is styled with parquet, modern lights and pleasant interior. Room height is about 3,25m (10ft). Adjustable airconditioning. SAT-TV (CNN - AlJazeera). Minibar. Phone. Spacious wardrope. Digital safe. Large windows. Kingsize bed 180cm (6ft) wide with two single beds which can be separated if you prefer so. Bathroom has amenities, hair dryer, phone, spotless bath with shower and small "foot-pool" as usual in spanish hotel. I recommend that styled dinner restaurant they have. Good menu and good service. There is a buffet also f.ex. families. I will come this hotel again. Okay it is not in the center but it has good value for hotel stay comparing other four star hotels in the city which are more expensive of course. Shuttle bus service every 20 min. But you know the schedule. Then from Airport change bus A1 to Barcelona center, Plaza Catalunya. Fare is 3.75 EUR and travel time 30min. Or take taxi. Definitely an international four star hotel. Best I had in my stays in Spain. And this hotel is completely non smoking!

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Barcelona Aeropuerto
HotelInfo.Address: Parque De Negocios Mas Blau II | Prat de Llobregat, 08820 Barcelona, Spain
